=Use Cases=

For quality assurance, starting from the soon to be release version 1.8.0 of the metalmouth extension, all of the following basic use cases must be able to be completed without issue (on Windows and Mac) before a new version of the metalmouth extension can be considered to be acceptable for public release.   This document is incomplete and will be added to shortly, and updated over time.

----
==Installation of packaged metalmouth extension==

===Installation from Project metalmouth website===

Precondition(s):
  # Chrome browser installed.

Action(s):
  # Download / install extension from Project metalmouth website (http://code.google.com/p/metalmouth/downloads/list).

Expected outcome(s):
  # Extension is listed in chrome://settings/extensions.
  # metalmouth icon button is added into toolbar.  The icon shows a closed mouth.

===Installation from Chrome Web Store===

Precondition(s):
  # Chrome browser installed.

Action(s):
  # Download / install extension from Project metalmouth page on Chrome Web Store (https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/bmogbhmnbehfapbmjlaoflagfobahfli).

Expected outcome(s):
  # Extension is listed in chrome://extensions/.
  # metalmouth icon button is added into toolbar.  The icon shows a closed mouth.

----
==Starting metalmouth extension==

===Omnibox method===

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.  
  # Chrome's omnibox has focus (to be certain use shortcut to focus omnibox Windows / Linux: Ctrl+L or Mac: ⌘-L.

Action(s): 
  # Press the 'm' key twice.

Expected outcome(s):
  # metalmouth extension should start with the words "metalmouth extension starting".
  # metalmouth extension button icon should change from having a closed mouth to an open mouth.

===Metalmouth button method===

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.  

Action(s): 
  # Click the metalmouth icon button in the toolbar.

Expected outcome(s):
  # metalmouth extension should start with the words "metalmouth extension starting".
  # metalmouth extension button icon should change from having a closed mouth to an open mouth.

----
==Tab-level interaction==

Window shortcuts - http://www.google.com/support/chrome/bin/static.py?page=guide.cs&guide=25799&topic=28650
Mac shortcuts - http://www.google.com/support/chrome/bin/static.py?page=guide.cs&guide=25799&topic=28651&

===Create new tab===

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
 
Action(s):
  # Create a new tab using Chrome shortcuts (Windows / Linux: Ctrl+T or Mac: ⌘-T).

Expected outcome(s):
  # New tab is create.
  # Focus changes to new tab.
  # metalmouth should say "Opening new tab (tab number) showing (url)".
  
===Close current tab===

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
 
Action(s):
  # Close the current tab (selected) using Chrome shortcuts (Windows / Linux: Ctrl+W or Mac: ⌘-W).

Expected outcome(s):
  # Current tab is closed.
  # metalmouth should say "Closing tab (tab number)".
  # Focus changes to an open tab.
  # metalmouth should say "Moving focus to tab (tab number) showing (url)".

===Cycle through open tabs===

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
 
Action(s):
  # Cycle from the current tab (selected) to another open tab using Chrome shortcuts (Windows / Linux: Ctrl+Tab or Mac: Ctrl-Tab).

Expected outcome(s):
  # Focus changes to another open tab.
  # metalmouth should say "Moving focus to tab (tab number) showing (url)".

==metalmouth menu bar==

===Open metalmouth menu bar===

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
  # New tab has been opened.
  # metalmouth has started to read all.
 
Action(s):
  # Press tab.

Expected outcome(s):
  # metalmouth should stop reading all.
  # metalmouth menu bar should be visible.
  # metalmouth should say "Opening metlmouth menu".

===Close metalmouth menu bar using esc===

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
  # New tab has been opened.
  # metalmouth has started to read all.
  # metalmouth menu has been opened, with metalmouth saying "opening metalmouth menu" - read all has stopped.
  # Change location has focus.

Action(s):
  # Press esc.

Expected outcome(s):
  # metalmouth menu bar should be invisible.
  # metalmouth should say "Navigation mode entered".

===Close metalmouth menu bar using close button===

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
  # New tab has been opened.
  # metalmouth has started to read all.
  # metalmouth menu has been opened, with metalmouth saying "opening metalmouth menu" - read all has stopped.
  # Change location has focus.

Action(s):
  # Press tab until close menu button is focused.
  # Press enter when the close menu button is focused.

Expected outcome(s):
  # metalmouth menu bar should be invisible.
  # metalmouth should say "Navigation mode entered".

==metalmouth options==

===New Tab Page Option===

====Entering url====

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
  # metalmouth options page has been opened via metalmouth toolbar option - see use case "" (below).
 
Action(s):
  # Use in-tab navigation to move down to "new tab page" text input box.
  # Press enter to interact with the "new tab page" text input box.
  # The text input interaction area is now visible.
  # The text input area is focused.
  # Type in "http://www.google.co.uk".
  # Press enter. 

Expected outcome(s):
  # The text input interaction area is now invisible.
  # "http://www.google.co.uk" has appeared in the "new tab page" text box.

===Saving Options===

====Save & Close====

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
  # metalmouth options page has been opened via metalmouth toolbar option - see use case "" (below).
  # A url value has been entered into the "new tab page" text box.
  # Speech rate has been selected.
  # Always-on has been checked.
  # Voice input has been checked.  
 
Action(s):
  # Use in-tab navigation to move down to "Save & Close" button.
  # Press enter to click on the "Save & Close" button.

Expected outcome(s):
  # The options page should close.
  # metalmouth should say "Closing tab (tab number)".
  # Focus changes to an open tab.
  # metalmouth should say "Moving focus to tab (tab number) showing (url)".

====Confirming option(s) are saved====

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
  # metalmouth options page has been opened via metalmouth toolbar option - see use case "" (below).
 
Action(s):
  # Use in-tab navigation to move down to "new tab page" text input box.
  # Then use in-tab navigation to move down to "Speech Rate" range input box.
  # Then use in-tab navigation to move down to "Always-on" checkbox.
  # Then use in-tab navigation to move down to "Voice input" checkbox.

Expected outcome(s):
  # When the "New tab page" text input box is focused metalmouth should say "new tab page text input box current value http://www.google.co.uk".
  # When the "Speech rate" range input box is focused metalmouth should say "".
  # When the "Always-on" checkbox is focused metalmouth should say "".
  # When the "Speech rate" checkbox is focused metalmouth should say "".

==New Tab Page==

===Default - No URL Entered===

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
 
Action(s):
  # Create a new tab using Chrome shortcuts (Windows / Linux: Ctrl+T or Mac: ⌘-T).

Expected outcome(s):
  # New tab is create.
  # Focus changes to new tab.
  # If the new tab shows chrome://newtab the contents should be updated to show (by default) Google's Accessible Search page.  
  # metalmouth should say "Opening new tab (tab number) showing (url)".

===URL Entered===

Precondition(s): 
  # metalmouth extension is installed.
  # metalmouth extension is on - metalmouth icon button shows an open mouth.
  # The "new tab page" option has been set to a url in the metalmouth options page.
  # The options page has been saved and closed, using the save & close button.
 
Action(s):
  # Create a new tab using Chrome shortcuts (Windows / Linux: Ctrl+T or Mac: ⌘-T).

Expected outcome(s):
  # New tab is create.
  # Focus changes to new tab.
  # If the new tab shows chrome://newtab the tab should be updated to the url defined by the user in the "new tab page" option.  
  # metalmouth should say "Opening new tab (tab number) showing (url)".
